abstract.p: ISO/TS 10303-1297:2004 specifies the application module for AP239 document management.
The following are within the scope of ISO/TS 10303-1297:2004
abstract.li: the identification, classification and representation of documents, both digital and non-digital and their versions and definitions;
the assignment of properties and management information, such as dates, approvals, people and organizations to documents and files;
the representation of predicted and observed states of documents;
the representation of messages and envelopes for messages;
the representation of the rights to access information about part designs, realized parts, documents, and requirements.

mapping.changes.description: The mapping table has been updated to ensure that it correctly reflects the original module information for modules that have been split and the mapping specification for Identification_assignment.items has been revised.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation and classification of documents and document information that may apply to product data, activity data, document information, or other documents. This module combines the functionality of the following modules to provide the capability to classify and represent documents, document information, and management information:
The module enables the representation of:

ul.li: information that identifies documents () and versions of documents ();

li.note: The definition of the product or activity data to which the document or document section is assigned is provided by extending the select, , in a further module.

ul.li: definitions of document versions in a digital () or physical format ();
digital files () stored on an electronic storage device or non-digital hardcopies ();
relationships between files () or document definitions ();
assignment of properties to a particular representation of a document version or a file ().

purpose.p: The module enables the definition a document. A document is defined as a body of information that can be packaged for delivery on a single medium. Some examples of documents are:
A document may be represented by a set of digital files that collectively represents a complete digital document.
Electronic document representations are sets of digital files that collectively represent the entire document.
purpose.example: A set of raster files, a set of IGES files, or a combination set of raster and IGES files that represent a complete document.
purpose.p: Non-electronic document representations are sets of pages, sheets, cards, or other medium, together with the message recorded on the medium that collectively represents the entire document. A document may have more than one document representation; some of these may be electronic while others are not. All document representations of a single iteration of a particular document should have consistent information content; formats (both electronic and visual) may vary, but the content should be the same. Different formats are different representations of the document.
purpose.example: Paper plots of technical drawings, Mylar traces, microfiche, or floppy disks are examples of non-digital files.
purpose.p: Document management provides a capability to attach, link or reference documents, with a limited set of metadata such as author, date, version title, type and encoding method; It also provides a capability to classify documents.

Document management also provides a capability to hold definitions of "documents" which can be generated directly from data held in any format. This provides ability to assemble documents from file, including pictures, images, videos and the results of queries on data held in any format. Document management enables holding information contained within intelligent documents.

The module enables the representation and classification of management information that may apply to document, product, or activity data. This module combines the functionality of the following modules to extend the capability to classify documents and document information, and to provide the capability to classify and represent management information.
The module provides the ability for other modules to assign management information to product and activity data. Such management information comprises:

In some cases this information is applied to the management data. For example, to specify who specified the security classification for some product data and when, requires the assignment of person and organization, and date and time to the security classification assignment.
The module provides for a classification of an attribute on an EXPRESS entity. The standard values used by the classification are defined as Classes .
purpose.note: The definition of the may be stored in an external class library.
When the attribute of an EXPRESS entity is classified, the value of the attribute on an instance of the EXPRESS entity will be the name or identifier of the class.
purpose.p: The module provides for the assignment of classification information to document, product, or activity data. This provides a generic capability that may be specialized and further constrained in other application modules.
The module specifies the representation of Classes that are defined external to a data exchange file in an External Class Library.
The module provides for the representation of assignments of an identifier to product or activity data.
The module enables set theory relationships between classes. This includes the following relationships:

The module specifies an application module for the representation of message. A message is a collection of information made at a particular time for some particular purpose. The message module contains the meta-data that describes the message. The structure and format of the content is out of scope, but is intended to range from a structured report corresponding to, say, a maintenance form, to an arbitrary collection of database abstracts, documents and other media as might correspond to a dossier on some unexpected problem with a product. Also out of scope is the sending of the message, which is covered by the application module.

The essential part of the message is its purpose. Message records this in three ways. Firstly, it may record the intentions of the sender, for example, "The attached gives evidence of severe cracking around the engine mountings. Request urgent grounding and inspection of the fleet". Secondly, the message will be part of a business process, and may be automatically processed. For example, an input made in the field by some automatic data recorder may simply be input into a database without further ado. Thirdly, a state may be associated to the message, which will enable tracking of the message through the process. Both sender and recipient may apply a state.

The module specifies an application module for the representation of an . An envelope is a wrapper for a . It is provided in order to maintain an audit trail of transmission. An envelope is a wrapper for a message. It is provided in order to maintain an audit trail of transmission. Increased volumes and frequency of transaction, particularly of small extracts from a database, require the association of transmission information with the database. For example, in an automated support environment, failure to notify significant faults, maintenance actions or procedural changes may be legally significant. Just as with a physical letter where the envelope is quite distinct from the content, in this module, the envelope is quite distinct from the message it contains. Provision is also made to use the envelope entity to send back receipts.

The module specifies an application module for the representation of rights concerning the access and use of information. That is, it records the right of a person or organization to use information in a certain way, or for a certain purpose. These rights include ownership of copyright, ownership of intellectual property or a grant to use information, perhaps restricted to a particular contract. Rights over personal data are not considered.

The recording of usage rights is important in collaborative work, particularly where a shared data environment is used. Such an environment may contain data from several competing companies, none of whom may see the other's data, although all such data may be visible to a coordinating contractor.

The module allows the recording of a particular right, the historical act of granting that right to an organization, perhaps under a particular contract, and the assignment of that right to particular data items. The granting of the right can be approved in general, or only for specific items of data. The latter would be used where special permission is needed for a particular data item. Under this module, rights cannot be granted to a general class of item, and this would need an extension to the current module. The module supports both the recording of the currently available rights and the history of granting rights.

Rights are always defined within a legal framework. It is incumbent on users of this model to ensure that the legal framework is in place under which the rights are interpreted, and to ensure that the use and interpretation of rights are well defined.
The module specifies the representation of a type of state.
The state definition module identifies a type of state by specifying the criteria that shall be satisfied for something to be in a state of that type.
purpose.example: A state definition that is defined by the presence of an identified type of fault in a type of product.
purpose.p: The module specifies the representation of state observed.

The state observed module identifies an observed state, which may be either predicted or actual, and enabling it to be linked to the thing or things that are in the state. An observed state represents a period of time when the criteria defining the state type either are or will be satisfied for one or more items. Actual observed states therefore correspond to a period in the life of something. States are not limited to products but may apply to activities, people, and organizations.

inscope.li: the assignment of documents, or sections of documents to contracts, certification, people, organization and identification assignments;
assignment of properties to a file;
assignment of properties to a particular representation of a document version;
definition of a document version in a digital format such as an electronic file;
definition of a document version in a non-digital format such as paper copy;
identification of a digital file, such as a file on a computer system;
identification of a document;
identification of a physical file, such as a stack of paper;
identification of a version of a document;
identification of Document_definitions in a digital or physical storage system;
identification of Files in a digital or physical storage system;
relationships between document definitions;
relationships between files;
specification of document-specific properties;
specification of locations of Document_definitions in a digital or physical storage system;
specification of locations of Files in a digital or physical storage system;
specification of the representation of document-specific properties;
facility to assign management information to product data;
facility to assign management information to activity data;
facility to assign management information to management data;
assignment of management information to management data;
the association of a value, represented by a class, to an attribute on an entity representing management information;
assignment of classification information to management information;
the identification of a class that is external to a data exchange file;
the identification of an external class library that is not in an exchange file and holds the definition for classes used in the exchange file;
a reference to a class in an external class library;
assignment of an identification to management information;
definition of state;
definition of what is needed for a state definition to exist;
relationship between two or more state definitions;
relationship between a state definition or type of state and the product, people or organization that it affects;
identification of individual or realized states;
relationship between two or more states;
relationship between an individual or realized state and the product, people or organization that it affects;
the assignment of an observed and predicted state to documents, versions of document, and definitions of documents;
identification of a message;
identification of the creator and creation date of a message;
identification of the approver of a message;
recording the state of the message with respect to that business process;
application of a security classification to a message;
association of messages with each other;
identification of the contents of a message;
identification of an envelope;
identification of the sender of the envelope and date sent;
identification of the recipient of the envelope and date received;
authorisation of the sending of the message;
representation of the solicitation of a receipt for the envelope and subsequent acknowledgement;
association of envelopes to each other;
assignment of properties to the envelope;
the definition of an information right;
the historical record of granting and revoking a right to a person or organization;
the association of the right to particular information items;
the approval of the general grant of the right;
the approval of a specific grant of a right against particular items of information;
the identification of the contract under which the right is granted;
the relationship of information usage rights to each other;
identification of a language;
identification of the language in which a text attribute is expressed;
association of a translation in a particular language to a text attribute.

outscope.li: assignment of Parts to product or activity data;
assignment of properties to a Part or Product;
assignment of properties to a particular representation of a Part or Product version;
definition of a Part or Product version;
identification of a Part or Product;
identification of a version of a Part or Product;
identification of Part_versions in a digital or physical storage system;
relationships between Part or Product definitions;
relationships between Parts or Products;
specification of locations of Parts or Products;
specification of Part-specific or Product-specific properties;
specification of the representation of Part-specific or Product-specific properties;
assignment of management information to product data;
assignment of management information to activity data;
the existence of a class;
characterization of a classification;
the contents of an external class library;
the definition of a set or class; Definition of a set or class is within the scope of the Class application module .
classification and the specification of complete set membership;
mappings between sets or classes;
class or set relationships that are not set theory relationships.
